description.raw: Bugfix of a special case where the ruler-scale is automatically adjusted (10*resolution) even if the user set the ruler-scale to 10. For example if the resolution and the ruler-scale are manually set to 10, the ruler-scale will automatically be 100. The issue is that the condition to auto-adjust the ruler-scale is set to check differences between the default ruler-scale value and the res.ruler_scale which is by default 10 if not specified by the user. The solution here is to check the options.ruler_scale which is None is not specified by the user.

The solution here is to check the options.ruler_scale which is None is not specified by the user.
